name: Ferric Citrate
indications: ferric citrate tablets phosphate binder indicated control serum phosphorus levels adult patients chronic kidney disease dialysis . ( 1 ) ferric citrate tablets iron replacement product indicated treatment iron deficiency anemia adult patients chronic kidney disease dialysis . ( 1 )
contraindications: • hyperphosphatemia chronic kidney disease dialysis : • starting dose 2 tablets orally 3 times per day meals . ( 2.1 ) • adjust dose 1 2 tablets needed maintain serum phosphorus target levels , maximum 12 tablets daily . dose titrated 1-week longer intervals . ( 2.1 ) • iron deficiency anemia chronic kidney disease dialysis : • starting dose 1 tablet orally 3 times per day meals . ( 2.2 ) • adjust dose needed achieve maintain hemoglobin goal , maximum 12 tablets daily . ( 2.2 )
adverseReactions: ferric citrate tablets contraindicated patients iron overload syndromes ( e.g . , hemochromatosis ) [ ( 5.1 ) ] .
indications_original: Ferric citrate tablets are a phosphate binder indicated for the control of serum phosphorus levels in adult patients with chronic kidney disease on dialysis. ( 1 ) Ferric citrate tablets are an iron replacement product indicated for the treatment of iron deficiency anemia in adult patients with chronic kidney disease not on dialysis. ( 1 )
contraindications_original: • Hyperphosphatemia in Chronic Kidney Disease on Dialysis: • Starting dose is 2 tablets orally 3 times per day with meals. ( 2.1 ) • Adjust dose by 1 to 2 tablets as needed to maintain serum phosphorus at target levels, up to a maximum of 12 tablets daily. Dose can be titrated at 1-week or longer intervals. ( 2.1 ) • Iron Deficiency Anemia in Chronic Kidney Disease Not on Dialysis: • Starting dose is 1 tablet orally 3 times per day with meals. ( 2.2 ) • Adjust dose as needed to achieve and maintain hemoglobin goal, up to a maximum of 12 tablets daily. ( 2.2 )
adverseReactions_original: Ferric citrate tablets are contraindicated in patients with iron overload syndromes (e.g., hemochromatosis) [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)].
